eligibility.question: Who can apply for the SAF?
eligibility.answer: Full-time and part-time students registered in courses leading to a Level 6-10 higher education award are eligible. Applicants must provide proof of receiving a SUSI grant, a means-tested social welfare payment, or be a HEAR student. More details: https://tus.ie/student-assistance-fund

application_process.question: How do I apply for the SAF?
application_process.answer: Complete the online application form and upload supporting documentation. Hard copies are not accepted.

application_process.question: How often can I apply for the SAF?
application_process.answer: Only one application per academic year is allowed.

application_process.question: How is my SAF application assessed?
application_process.answer: Applications are reviewed individually by a subcommittee of the Student Assistance Fund Committee based on submitted evidence.

payments.question: How will I receive my SAF payment?
payments.answer: Payments are made by electronic fund transfer (EFT) to the bank details provided.

payments.question: When will I be notified about the outcome of my SAF application?
payments.answer: You will receive an email to your student account after all applications have been reviewed.

appeals.question: Can I appeal if my SAF application is not approved?
appeals.answer: Yes, you can request a review by emailing saf.midlands@tus.ie

eligibility_repeats.question: Can I apply for the SAF if I am repeating a year?
eligibility_repeats.answer: Yes, repeat students attending modules can apply. However, students registered for repeat exams only are not eligible.

required_documents.question: What documents do I need to provide for the SAF?
required_documents.answer: Documents include a SUSI award letter, proof of social welfare payments, or confirmation of HEAR student status.

deadlines.question: When is the SAF application deadline?
deadlines.answer: Semester 1 applications close on October 31, 2024, at 5 PM. Semester 2 applications close on February 21, 2025, at 5 PM.
